meanings.definition: The act of destroying or damaging something
meanings.sent1: The wrecking of the toy was accidental.
meanings.sent2: The wrecking of the vase was a result of the cat's playfulness.
meanings.sent3: The wrecking of the cake made it look like modern art.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like a wrecking ball, causing damage everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The wrecking of the sandcastle left a trail of destruction.

meanings.definition: The act of causing the destruction of a ship or other vehicle
meanings.sent1: The pirate's wrecking of the ship was swift.
meanings.sent2: The iceberg was responsible for the wrecking of the Titanic.
meanings.sent3: The wrecking of the boat turned into an unexpected swimming lesson.
meanings.sent4: The storm acted as a wrecking crew, sinking ships left and right.
meanings.sent5: The wrecking of the submarine was a scene from an action movie.

meanings.definition: The act of demolishing a building or structure
meanings.sent1: The wrecking of the old house began at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The wrecking of the bridge was necessary for the new construction.
meanings.sent3: The wrecking of the tower revealed hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: The wrecking ball swung, bringing down the building in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The wrecking of the wall opened up a whole new view.
